message.content: Let the first term be $a$ and the common ratio be $r=\frac18$. Recall that the sum of an infinite geometric series is $\frac{a}{1-r}$, so we have $\frac{a}{1-r}=60$. Substituting $r=\frac18$, we have $\frac{a}{1-\frac18}=60$. Simplifying the denominator gives $\frac{a}{1-\frac18}=\frac{a}{\frac78}=\frac{8a}{7}=60$. Multiplying both sides by $\frac78$ gives $8a=7\cdot 60=420$, so $a=\boxed{52.5}$.
